scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
JPEG is included in 2 national catalogues of recommended specifications. They belong to Estonia and Spain. The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) of these Member States is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets. 

National catalogue Estonia:
https://www.mkm.ee/sites/default/files/interoperability-framework_2011.doc

National catalogue Spain:
https://administracionelectronica.gob.es/pae_Home/pae_Estrategias/pae_Interoperabilidad_Inicio/pae_Normas_tecnicas_de_interoperabilidad.html#CATALOGOESTANDARES

NIFO factsheets:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/national-interoperability-framework-observatory-nifo/nifo-factsheets

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
Even though JPEG is supporting the first level of maturity from the Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for the Open data, which allows the availability of the information over the internet, the specification cannot be considered as an asset to foster data as open data. 

JEPG ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/18902.html

JPEG public reference:
https://jpeg.org/jpeg/

Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for Open Data:
https://5stardata.info/en/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specificationÂ
statement:
ISO has defined a clear procedure to develop its standards. It consists in a 6-steps process where everyone who is interested can participate. However, if you want to participate, you have to contact your national standards body and you have to be approved for joining the Technical committee (TC) who will develop the standard. ISO has defined the roadmap of standards, it is composed of 6 steps as before said. For the approval of a standard the two-thirds majority of P-members of TC is needed. If the result is negative, the document is returned to TC/SC to be further studied.

The ISO standardization process: 
https://www.iso.org/stages-and-resources-for-standards-development.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: A public review is part of the decision-making process.
statement:
As defined on the TC standardisation, only TC members are involved in the development of ISO standards. A review is carried out to arrange the consensus firstly within the TC members and subsequently is reviewed by the different ISO member bodies. However, it cannot be considered a public review, because only TC members can participate.

The ISO standardization process: 
https://www.iso.org/stages-and-resources-for-standards-development.html

criterion_description: The specification is available for everyone to study.
statement:
The ISO 10918-1:1994 which refers to JPEG is not available for free for everyone to study. Payment is needed to reach access to the standard.

JEPG ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/18902.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
There are no disclosures of ISO IPR Database to identify the licensing under the specification. ISO 10918-1:1994 (JPEG) is not listed in ISO/IEC/ITU Common Patent policy, so it cannot be confirmed that the specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis.

ISO patents:
https://www.iso.org/iso-standards-and-patents.html 

ISO standards and patents IPR database:
http://isotc.iso.org/livelink/livelink/13622347/Patents_database.xls?func=doc.Fetch&nodeId=13622347

criterion_description: The specification has a strong support from at least one developer community.
statement:
The Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG) committee has a long tradition in the creation of still image coding standards. JPEG is a joint working group of the International Standardization Organization (ISO) and the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC). It can be found in the particular website created to communicate and gather information about the JPEG standard. This website is known as jpeg.org. 

The specification in ISO: 
https://www.iso.org/standard/18902.html

JPEG.org:
https://jpeg.org/jpeg/index.html

criterion_description: The specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
JPEG is a valuable image format for sharing information through the internet between administrations and stakeholders in a graphical manner. Allowing sharing data and information the standard foster the visibility of administration data and services. Fostering the collaboration between public administrations, the specification eases the decision-making process of institutions.

JEPG ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/18902.html

JPEG public reference:
https://jpeg.org/jpeg/

statement:
As a way to compress images and easing the communication of graphic information, it can ease the comprehensibility of the administration's data, rules, and services. By allowing a more visual representation of the information, it contributes to the easy understanding of bucks of different data.

https://www.iso.org/standard/18902.html

criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement:
There are many documents and studies around the JPEG, functionalities, and effectiveness, and efficiency. An example of this is an article in The International society for optics and photonics. It is published in the SPIE Library, and it is about the evolution of the standard and the different capabilities of the specification in terms of image representation.

SPIE Library: 
https://www.spiedigitallibrary.org/journals/journal-of-electronic-imaging/volume-27/issue-04/040901/JPEG-1-standard-25-years--past-present-and-future/10.1117/1.JEI.27.4.040901.full?SSO=1

criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
JPEG is already associated to an EIRA ABB in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). Specifically, JPEG can define the interoperability aspects of the "Representation" ABB from the EIRA Semantic view. 

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement: No evidences have been found of the specification being included in a formal interoperability agreement between organisations involved in the European public services provision.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of JEPG is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

JEPG ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/18902.html

JPEG public reference:
https://jpeg.org/jpeg/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement:
The purpose of JEPG is not related to organisational interoperability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

JEPG ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/18902.html

JPEG public reference:
https://jpeg.org/jpeg/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
JPEG does not define a reusable cross-sector data model, but it defines a standardised manner to deal with images while sharing, creating, or editing.

JEPG ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/18902.html

JPEG public reference:
https://jpeg.org/jpeg/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
Although JPEG is supporting the first level of maturity from the Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for the Open data, it is not supporting the main principles for the publication of data as Linked Open Data.  

JEPG ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/18902.html

JPEG public reference:
https://jpeg.org/jpeg/

5-star linked open data:
https://www.w3.org/DesignIssues/LinkedData.html
